content:
That's a great idea! Sharing your own positive experience with the personalized photo album can be a nice way to inspire your sister to consider getting a similar gift for someone special in her life. It's also a thoughtful way to show her that you're thinking of her and willing to share your own ideas and experiences with her.

By mentioning the price point of around $40, you're also giving her a sense of what to expect in terms of cost, which can be helpful if she's considering getting a similar gift. Who knows, she might even ask you for more information about the online store or the gift itself, which can lead to a nice conversation about your shared interests and experiences.

Remember to share your story in a casual and conversational way, rather than making it a sales pitch. You might say something like:

"Hey, sis, I wanted to mention that I recently got a great deal on a personalized photo album for mom's anniversary. It was only around $40, and it turned out so beautifully! I think it would make a really thoughtful gift for someone special. You might want to consider it for someone in your life..."

By sharing your experience in a friendly and low-key way, you can inspire your sister to think about getting a similar gift without feeling like you're pushing her to make a purchase. Good luck!
